## Introduction

Rigs of Rods is an open source simulator software designed to offer realistic vehicle physics simulation. This software is designed as a sandbox game, which means users can simulate various driving and flying vehicles in different environments. It was developed to be an educational tool, allowing users to learn about physics and vehicle dynamics in an engaging way.

## Features

Rigs of Rods is feature-packed, offering users a variety of tools and settings to customize their simulation experience. Here are some of the notable features of this software:

### Accurate Vehicle Models

This software uses a finite element analysis solver to simulate real-world vehicle dynamics. This means it generates accurate simulation models for various vehicles, including boats, planes, trucks, and cars.

### Various Environments

Users can select among various environments to test their vehicle models. These environments offer different types of terrain, such as hills, deserts, and cities, and also allow users to test their vehicle models in a range of weather conditions.

### Customizable Controls

This software allows users to customize the controls of their vehicle models to suit their own preferences. It also offers various control options based on what type of vehicle is being simulated.

### Moddability and Customization

One of the best things about this software is that it is incredibly moddable. This means users can customize the software to their liking, adding new vehicle models, environments, and even new physics models.

## System Requirements

Rigs of Rods is a free, open-source software that can run on Windows, Mac, and Linux operating systems. In order to run this software, your computer must meet the following system requirements:

* Operating System: Windows XP or newer / macOS 10.6 Snow Leopard or newer / Linux 2.6 kernel or newer
* Processor: 2 GHz or faster
* RAM: 2 GB or more
* Graphics Card: DirectX 9-compatible or OpenGL 2.0-compatible

## Conclusion

In conclusion, Rigs of Rods is an excellent vehicle physics simulator software that is increasingly being used by educational institutions to teach their students about physics and vehicle dynamics. It is also an excellent tool for hobbyists who are interested in tinkering with vehicle models and developing custom physics models. If vehicle dynamics and simulations interest you, this software is definitely worth checking out.
